place.name: HARWELL
place.gazetteerText: HARWELL, a village and a parish in Wantage district, Berks. The village stands 2½ miles SW of Didcot r. station, and 6 E by N of Wantage; and has a postoffice under Steventon, Berks. The parish comprises 2, 482 acres. Real property, £4, 940. Pop., 876. Houses, 202. The property is subdivided. The manor belonged, in the 13th century, to Richard King. of the Romans; and belongs now to Sir John Chetwode, Bart. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Oxford. Value, £320. Patron, the Rev. S. M. Smith. The church is chiefly decorated English; is cruciform, with embattled tower; was recently in bad condition; and contains several monuments. There are a Wesleyan chapel, a national school, alms Houses with £141, and other charities with £162. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
